title: Banned for what?
body:
So, I get home from school today, check my E-Mails, to see an one from "league of Legends" Thought "Oh maybe it's just one of those we miss you come back" E-Mails that you get after you don't play games for a while. Turns out I got banned for Third party use on a game I havent played in a while (Study hit me hard)
Anyway, I dispute it of course, assume it was my awful attempt at installing custom skins recently, who knows.
I get an E-Mail back from riot, basic copy paste "Can't tell you why you're not banned because reasons" Yeah thanks.
I did a bit of reading on other boards about programs that can cause bans and saw curse voice pop up. I mean, I have it, used it once back in the day and that was it, haven't seen it since. Other things are just simple ping-checkers.
Anyone have more info on this? would be appreciated. the support emails aren't very helpful...

I'm pretty pissed to say the least, I mean, surely if I was a "1337 hackr scripting pro" my winrate would be higher and I wouldn't be playing thresh adc in bronze.


ps. sorry for rant, i'm salty

replies.body:
Custom skins count under the detection of 3rd party influence.

The client has no way to tell the difference, hence why it says in the ToS to use custom skins at your own risk.
too me aswel but the 3rd party I used I got rid of months ago and got given a 1 day ban    now perma ban   {{item:3070}}

Mine was out of the blue, no one day ban "warning" to do a fresh install, or even anything that I could see that would interfere with my game. (Other than of course what I mentioned, but of course I didn't think a perms ban would happen over this)

Why da flying fk would they warn you for scripting nerd???????????

GTFO and play DOTA 2

lelele
